tweets.text: @EnvAgency i am sure that you have made a difference in some areas. i reported continuing pollution about a month ago to a stream in lancashire. i took a sample of the oily deposits. i have had no follow up, no visit, no call. is there any point reporting pollution?
@EnvAgency Even the right wing press are unimpressed https://t.co/TiHlQGmti4
@EnvAgency You could start by stopping water companies from dumping raw sewage in them and then move on to excessive abstraction from our chalk streams

Rivers are vital to our environment. We respond to an environmental incident every 45 minutes to stop and reverse damage to our rivers. 
 
Let's work together to protect them. 
 
#WorldRiversDay https://t.co/0d3EzXd2ic

Looking at the replies to this it appears the truth is now out there.

The @EnvAgency are a ‚ÄúFailed and discredited organisation‚Äù. https://t.co/B2JJlcQ0hj

#2 Thanks to @DonCatchmentRT, @CanalRiverTrust @EnvAgency @YorkshireWater and @RMBCPress, salmon will be seen in Sheffield for the first time in 200 years! ü§Ø This is due to the completion of work enabling fish passage at 18 previously impassable weirs üëä https://t.co/2VIBslDET1

tweets.text: A big surge in rivers being adopted by pressure groups. If you know of an orphaned river take it under your wings. The good people at @AquiferChalk are creating a tool kit for you. We need more of you because the @EnvAgency under current senior management are useless.

We are currently arguing with the @EnvAgency about how they categorise and count sewage discharges. They are digging their heels in and now suggest damp ground is an acceptable reason to discharge sewage.

@Natures_Voice Ask @DefraGovUK and the @EnvAgency why they decided farming rules for water (a law) should be advisory and not enforced? @Feargal_Sharkey @ashsmith43 Odd, how no #rivers meet good ecological quality status @TonyJuniper @ZacGoldsmith @BenGoldsmith @theriverstrust @AnglingTrust https://t.co/OumrDQAm3U

üíß store carbon

urls.title: The Flood Strategy is go!
urls.description: The Environment Agency‚Äôs Flood and Coastal Erosion Risk Management Strategy finished its journey through Parliament, meaning that we can start to put it into action, getting the nation better protected and prepared for the effects of climate change for decades to come.

tweets.text: https://t.co/Lq1ztMH1yB It‚Äôs go! The strategy outlines how businesses need to play their part in flood resilience. Look out for our workshops on PFR and NFM to see how we can support your business to get involved @EmmaHowardBoyd @UniOfHull @EnvAgency #floodinnovation #PFR #NFM
Great messages, conveyed brilliantly; SMNR, NFM, and the importance of restoration & geomorph as delivery mechanisms https://t.co/NiVrDnXpOO https://t.co/CJaKQypkUJ
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Clearly no pressure from government or anyone else above on them to answer any criticism. So their neglect of rivers is condoned if not supported...

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Worth dropping a line to @CommonsEAC (details at end of https://t.co/LEgMuDyTeO ) and ask them to hold an inquiry on @EnvAgency's performance as a regulator protecting chalk streams from over-extraction & pollution by water companies.

A long and sorry tale for both the Tyler family and the River Chess.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/UVit1r1Z9c

tweets.text: Working to save vital chalk streams like @RiverChess, and hoping a big reduction in water abstraction by @AffinityWater will improve river levels. But that just leaves the @thameswater sewage problem. Listen to @BBCWorldatOne report here: https://t.co/5Ogh9r6Oh1

The new flood and coast strategy has to be laid in Parliament for 40 days before being adopting - those 40 days have passed so it is now fully live! Thanks to everyone & every organisation that‚Äôs help make this happen - now let‚Äôs deliver it! https://t.co/5gc6zcUs1t https://t.co/X823gMNaR6

Transporting waste around the world is part of a multi-million-pound industry, and waste criminals can take advantage of this.  

Port officer Melvyn blogs about how he helps prevent illegal exports of waste to help protect our environment: https://t.co/p2B04tOYSo https://t.co/qCRbaZGPzr

BREAKING NEWS! In even more evidence of the #naturecrisis facing the UK - new analysis has revealed that the UK is at the BOTTOM of the league table of how much nature it has left compared to countries in the EU #ReviveourWorld

https://t.co/m8MQcNB9Ui https://t.co/cuh3as1HuA

Boaters update : Marsh Lock has a fault and is only operating on handwind. EA Engineer scheduled to attend first thing tomorrow morning Apologises for any inconvenience caused. @thamesmobo @MarkHill03 @EnvAgencySE @wifo_ea @TW11Harbour
@jaynebettridge @SNorfolkCouncil @EnvAgencyAnglia Hi Jayne, can you advise the location for this please. & we'll get a job raised. Thanks - Rob

* No English river met @EnvAgency quality tests for pollution
* Only 14% are of "good ecological standard"
* 200,000 sewage discharges per yr
"A culture is no better than its rivers." (WH Auden, adapted)
Water companies & EA cuts are leading to disaster.
https://t.co/BuihH2ZNHN

David Attenborough: "Saving our planet is now a communications challenge."

Boris Johnson: how about I appoint climate change deniers to chair the BBC and Ofcom?

Our ports could be hiding #WasteCrime activity. 
 
Waste criminals try to profit from selling and exporting waste abroad, leaving it for someone else to deal with and potentially harming the environment. 
 
Our port officers work to stop this waste from travelling abroad üëá https://t.co/vgNsZEAPtV

tweets.text: We have now started tests at #Twerton, to simulate what happened at the gate last Tuesday 15 Sept. We will continue to run the tests and observe the gate until 1.00pm, when we will reset the normal river level. https://t.co/XJwA4M1N3w

New flood warning services now operating in #Midlands. Services for 2 areas of #Upton-on-Severn went live today. Existing services in #Leominster now modified to include additional properties. Sign up to receive flood warnings here 
https://t.co/BrDa44Cffv https://t.co/3p6QPsuOLx
Filming fish in the river tonight, it‚Äôs extremely healthy lots of activity. #rivers our Cheshire rivers are fully alive and healthy @EnvAgency @JackPerksPhoto https://t.co/mCBKkIWdKd

Sarratt Meeting 5 No appearance from the @EnvAgency who sent a woefully inaccurate briefing note on the recent sewage discharges into the @RiverChess. With every change to the regulations they make it easier for water companies to discharge sewage into rivers, should be ashamed.

@WoodlandTrust @BarrowMember @DefraGovUK @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency If only we supported the amazing people in our communities who are changing things for the better every day in small ways with small grants we'd see an even bigger positive impact.
Heavy rain = sewage and sanitary debris on our street @AnglianWater @SNorfolkCouncil @EnvAgencyAnglia usual postcard NR15 2JR https://t.co/mFZT6Y2Kjt

Being ignored doesn't make the problem go away.
